overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a practical approach to time-series forecasting under constraints, focusing on identifying daily seasonality and handling limited data. The analyst initially considers advanced models like SARIMA but defaults to a simple averaging method due to the absence of computational tools. The solution prioritizes simplicity and completeness, generating forecasts by repeating an averaged daily pattern while acknowledging limitations like ignoring trends.
common_data_patterns: No explicit missing values in provided data
key_insights: Daily seasonality (period=24) is the dominant pattern for hourly data
Simple averaging of corresponding hours across historical days provides a viable baseline forecast
Limited data (96 points) restricts complex modeling, favoring heuristic approaches
Forecasts must be complete (no missing values) regardless of input data warnings
complexity_analysis: Moderate complexity: Starts with advanced model considerations (SARIMA) but simplifies to heuristic methods. Includes data inspection, pattern identification, and step-by-step calculations, though constrained by the no-code limitation.
